DataElement.preferredName: Pulmonary Or Systemic Viral Infection Integer::90 Day Post Bone Marrow Transplant Text
DataElement.preferredDefinition: Text to describe virus(es) identified in pulmonary infections or systemic infections diagnosed 90 days post bone marrow transplantation.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Pulmonary Or Systemic Viral Infection Integer::90 Day Post Bone Marrow Transplantation

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: Relating to the lungs.:Or; used to connect words, phrases, or clauses representing alternatives; used to connect alternative terms for the same thing; used in correlation; used to correct or rephrase what was previously said; otherwise.:(sis-TEM-ik) Affecting the entire body.:Having to do with a virus.:A disorder resulting from the presence and activity of a microbial, viral, or parasitic agent. Concepts.definition: Relating to the lungs as the intended site of administration, where the pharmaceutical product is administered, usually by inhalation, for local action in the lower respiratory tract or for systemic action after absorption via the lower respiratory tract.

An article used to connect words, phrases, or clauses representing alternatives; used to connect alternative terms for the same thing; used in correlation; used to correct or rephrase what was previously said; otherwise.
Having to do with a virus.
A disorder resulting from the presence and activity of a microbial, viral, fungal, or parasitic agent. It can be transmitted by direct or indirect contact.

Property.preferredDefinition: A number with no fractional part.::90:The time for Earth to make a complete rotation on its axis; ordinarily divided into twenty-four hours.:Post; occuring after.:(trans-plan-TAY-shun) A procedure to replace bone marrow destroyed by treatment with high doses of anticancer drugs or radiation. Transplantation may be autologous (an individual's own marrow saved before treatment), allogeneic (marrow donated by someone else), or syngeneic (marrow donated by an identical twin).

Concepts.definition: A number with no fractional part, including the negative and positive numbers as well as zero.
The time for Earth to make a complete rotation on its axis; ordinarily divided into twenty-four hours, equal to 86 400 seconds. This also refers to a specific day.
Happening at a time subsequent to a reference time; later in time or order.
A procedure to replace diseased bone marrow with transplanted healthy bone marrow cells.
